website_summaries.verdict: Energy-efficient, oil-filled radiator. Great for small to medium-sized rooms. Slow warm-up, but long-lasting heat.
pros: Long-lasting heat for small to medium-sized rooms

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Either I'm very unlucky or there's some poor quality control going on at DeLonghi. My first order was leaking oil. Not just a minor leak, mind you. The entire box was saturated and the unit itself was covered. Ordered a replacement and while this one seemed to have all it's oil securely inside, it made terrible gurgling noises like a geothermal spring. I heard the noises coming from the next room while I was watching TV so I'm sure this is not normal. Definitely won't be trying another.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Great heater.
customer_reviews.text: No smell as far as oil goes. I used to have one that was 2x larger but I really like this one. I have a flat that is 1250 sq/feet heating up 900 to 1000 sq/feet. Something to note if you put a small fan behind it even on low it will heat up a much larger area even on 700 Watts. Or at least maintain the current temp.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Unit damaged beyond use, very poor QC
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered damaged. It looks like they just crammed a previously returned one in a box and just said “screw it, good enough.” The paperwork was shoved into the bottom and was all crinkled up, the powered side was broken off and wires exposed. If this is what DeLonghi’s QC looks like, I won’t buy another thing from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't produce heat in Phoenix... That's pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in an insulated 10x14 room and it makes no difference when I have it on HIGH! I live in Phoenix so trust me when I say it doesn't get that cold here and this thing still can't bring the temp up a few degrees.
customer_reviews.author: AGrayClay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome,  even, radiant heat.
customer_reviews.text: This heater is great! I have an old home, no insulation, and one 12x12 bedroom with no flooring. It's always freezing in there unless it's summer. I got this heater, set it on 1, and pushed the "comfortemp" button - the whole room was warm! I have one of these heaters in my bathroom as well, cannot use the 'comfortemp' button or my small bathroom becomes a sauna. I use it in my family room, love the wheels, you can unplug and move to where it's needed most. There is no remote, however, I don't find that to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Laura in Sacramento, Ca.

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat very well
customer_reviews.text: I first bought a DeLonghi oil-filled heater some 30 years ago. It still works and puts out more heat than this newer model. I bought this model to use in a bedroom of about 20' by 15' so that I would not have to run the whole-floor heat pump all night. The bedroom does not receive much sun during the winter time and is chilly at night. This heater barely raises the temperature by a couple of degrees, even if left on at full power all night. Perhaps it would be OK for a box room, but it is not effective in a larger room.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hood

customer_reviews.title: Good Heating, but with a Bright Green Glowing Light
customer_reviews.text: This heater is effective but has a bright green light near the control switches. Because we prefer to sleep in darkness it did not work out for our bedroom. We slept with it one night and thought the aliens were landing. The next day we took the old one out of the garage, which doesn't emit any light, and put this green glow machine into my husband's man-cave. If you aren't worried about excessive light pollution, it works just fine. We also tempered it for one night to eliminate any smell, which seemed to work. It doesn't smell at all. It just glows green.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Juillerat-Olvera

customer_reviews.title: Not Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine a handful of times the first winter. Second winter comes around an it worked 3-4 nights, then stopped heating up. Now I cant return it! This is the type of product I'd expect to last more than one season - instead, it's going to a landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: Two defective units in a row
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this heater as it is well reviewed and a quality heater. Mine arrived and upon using it the first time at the maximum settings as recommended in the owners manual, it leaked oil. Two days later the replacement heater arrived. Upon turning it on the lights illuminated but no heat was produced. Two heaters, two defective units. This has got to be unusual, but I wonder about their quality controls. We're going to go with a different type of heater.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Kass

customer_reviews.title: TOASTY ROASTY
customer_reviews.text: Creates nice ambiant heat. When we turned it on initially we set it on my number six! Once the room warmed up we adjusted the settings to minimal (number one )the room stays warm at all times. We purchased two units one in each bedroom and we keep the doors open and the whole entire upstairs hallway is heatEd. Hopefully will see a reduction in our energy bill cost as we eat our home with oil and we are using a lot of energy- almost twice that Of the average resident. Anyway I am enjoying the heaters this far
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself was fine and easy to use. We got it and turned it on, and prepared for the wait for it to warm up the room. Then we turned it up to the highest setting because it wasn't putting off much heat. It has been several days and the heat it puts out is like not having a heater in the room at all. It is still cold. When we tried another heater we have, it warmed it up easily, and that heater was 1400. This heater was an extreme disappointment and I do not recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Silla

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a short while then just went cold.
customer_reviews.text: I used this heater for maybe 40 to 50 hours on an occasional basis. The other day, it was on and working then it simply went cold. The lights remained on. I've tried since then to get it to work, but it will not heat. It's in pristine physical condition and has only been used indoors. I doubt I try to get a refund or replacement because I expect it to be a difficult (probably impossible) process. Instead I'll just never buy another DeLonghi heater of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Edit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect space heater for babies room*
customer_reviews.text: Perfect space heater for babies room* *A humidifier is a MUST in the winter. The only drawback: - smelled a lot first day of use. Recommend setting on high for first day in a well ventilated place - when left on auto, there is a loud click when’re the heater engages “on” or “off” . Took our baby a bit to get used and was startled by the click - haven’t had to use it in full power this winter and lvl 3 on low heat is perfect for us
customer_reviews.author: D and R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heater with more temp range than most!
customer_reviews.text: I have neen using oil filled radiant heaters for years and they're all pretty good.. The special thing about this brand and model, is that it has a greater range of temperature than others.. This can be important.. My Pelonis( NY1507-14A) Is often too hot for the situation at its lowest lossible setting(Economy 65°) But this DeLonghi has a much lower starting temp setting, that Ive found very useful.. I can easily maintain a comfortable temp in my very travel trailer with it..when I would "burn up" on the lowest Pelonis setting.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Loud clicking noises
customer_reviews.text: Makes loud clicking noises very frequently. Cannot use this in the bedroom, which is what I bought it for, it wakes us up and is very annoying. Am disappointing because I bought another style heater of this same brand that went out after not much use. Figured I'd try the oil filled heater, but again, am not happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good radiant heater.  Easier on the electric bills than generic baseboard heating.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brand as I had previous experience with a model ten years ago. This model has a giant button labeled "Comfort Temp." According to the user guide, "This heater actually saves you money by automatically maintaining the optimal room temperature." My question is, how is optimal room temperature determined? One night I decided to test drive the Comfort Temp feature. I activated the button. After about an hour, the temperature in the room hit 70o, at which point I shut off the heater. My optimal temperature is 65o. There is no way to adjust the optimal room temperature, so really, it is an arbitrary setting.
customer_reviews.author: WW-Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Steady, gentle quiet heat. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these heaters for our daughters' small home in PA while they were in college in 2012. It worked like a charm, even in that cold, frigid weather. It does not heat up quickly but puts off a gentle, completely quiet steady heat that has worked to keep rooms warm in several different homes over the 6 years we have owned it. We have recently been using it in a rather cold drafty room over the garage and I just bought a second one to help heat our vaulted ceiling great room that has large, drafty windows. If you are looking for steady, gentle, quiet heat this may be just the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonQueen

customer_reviews.title: I do like the radiant type heat better than a blower motor ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the power savings. I had my south facing back porch enclosed. When sun is shinning, the temp gets in the high 80's. However; with the previous heater I was using, my electric bill went up $100.00 for this very small room. That was my incentive to purchase this type of oil filled heater. So my electric bill has gone down, but the temperatures haven't been as cold as when I was using the little electric heater. However; I do like the radiant type heat better than a blower motor and it is so quiet. Otherwise, the heater is working great!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Laski

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater, Noisy on High
customer_reviews.text: This is a good space heater. We are using it in a large room to help the ineffective baseboard heaters that never keep our family room/kitchen warm enough. It definitely has helped greatly with this, and we can easily tell the difference when it is left off. The one drawback with this heater is that when put on the high setting (using the switches, regardless of the dial setting) it makes almost constant noise. A lot of cycles between different noise levels of buzzing and humming. We've just been leaving it on the medium setting and that keeps it from being annoyingly noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: The unit's cord caught FIRE last night!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a definite fire hazard. Last night the end of the plug shorted out and sparks from it started a fire on a nearby carpet. See my photos and those of other owners. The end completely melted. If you value your home and life, I would not buy this product. The company should recall this product immediately and re-design the plug. AMAZON should pull this product from their list. If I was asleep when this happen I might not be here today writing this review. BUYER RUN AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good heaters, unfortunate that the thermostat broke on one (too short of a manufacturer's warranty)
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these heaters and have found that they work wonderfully for small to medium-sized rooms. They're easy to use and easy to store in their original boxes. We use one for our 16-month-old's room, keeping the room at a comfortable temperature. Unfortunately, one of the heater's thermometer has seemingly lost the ability to keep a constant temperature. The only temperature that it may maintain is max...we wanted to exchange it and claim the manufacturer's but since we only use it for winters, the warranty has expired before we realized that there was a true problem. Bottom line, great heaters but be certain to check them before the warranty is expired.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: does not heat well
customer_reviews.text: We have used DeLonghi oil radiators for years. They have heated beautifully. We have rarely turned the heat control above low. This is why we ordered the same brand when we needed a new heater. The new one has been a total disappointment. We have to turn the control to medium and it still does not reach the heat output of older one. Had we not already used it and recycled the box, we would return it. Edit: We have to keep the new radiator on HI to have any feeling of added heat at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak heater, for 1500 watts this is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: After setting it outside for a day on full blast to rid the unit of the smell, I moved it into our bedroom. Running on full blast, 1500 watts, for a week now this thing doesn't put out any heat. I am going to return it this week. I bought a ceramic heater at the same time that has a fan and oscillates and it puts out tons of heat, pretty much our whole house on this tiny space heater. So, I already found my solution the Lasko 5307 ceramic tower heater, I would recommend it. This thing is junk, it barely keeps my dog warm when he lays next to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: DeLonghi gone awry...
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Durable construction -Radiant heat is less expensive than propane CONS: -Bright green ComforTemp light non-dimmable (too bright at night for bedroom) -ComforTemp instructions vague to non-existent -Fins exposed & too hot for child safety -Temp dial poorly designed, guesswork rather than accuracy I've used DeLonghi radiant heaters for decades. Generally, they're bulletproof and effective for heating Sierra Nevada Mt rooms. This model missed the mark. I'm returning it and have ordered a different Delonghi as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: mia coolpa

customer_reviews.title: Kept me warm all winter
customer_reviews.text: Pennsylvania is a cold place, especially when you live in the basement! To rescue myself, I bought a heater! I didn't expect it to be fancy, but it totally surprised me! I love how they designed the temperature control, which is a closed loop feedback system. I also worried about safety a lot, especially because I sleep like a caveman. But over the two winters I used the heater, my properties have been ultra safe!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Warmed Enclosed Porch Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We have an enclosed porch which was only suitable to use during the summer months. Now when the temps outside are colder (early spring and late autumn) we can still enjoy sitting in our porch. We don't anticipate we can use this once the snow flies, but this little heater does exactly what it advertises - slowly (and safely) warms the people (and cats!) sitting around it. We didn't expect it to heat a large area, nor did we want to try with an uninsulated porch. But on cool, rainy days, we throw on sweatshirts, and it's a nice place to sit and visit. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Patti Winker

customer_reviews.title: Works great, bought it to replace my 10 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, bought it to replace my 10 year old one that died. Was shipped in its own box, no extra packaging, had a couple dents on the front but doesn't affect the heater. The rollers are very hard to roll on carpet and there is no handle on the back side to help move it. My old one had a handle area on the front and back, and I would move it between two different areas frequently. Now I can barely move this one a few inches because the back is too hot to touch.
customer_reviews.author: Krash

customer_reviews.title: The BEST heater!
customer_reviews.text: Best oil filled heater that I have bought in 30 years. I rely on these heaters to remove the chill. I have often had to closely monitor these heaters so that they don’t get too hot at the outlet. I have had to replace more than one plug that melted at the outlet. This heater has a feature called “comfortemp”. Once you bring up the desired temp, you push the button called “comfortemp”. The heater maintains that temperature. You don’t have to be fiddling with the buttons and dials. It maintains that temperature. Best thing is that the cord, plug and outlet don’t get too hot. I’m a very satisfied customer. So is my parrot.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Olson

customer_reviews.title: Really Gives Good Heat...
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact DeLonghi oil filled radiator or more than 5 years. I took it to another property, sold the house and forgot to retrieve it. So, I purchased another oil filled radiator (not Delonghi) ,and it was pathetic. Barely heated my 13' x 7' office space. So I gave it to charity, and replaced it with this Delonghi which is so much better. Takes a bit to warm up, but it is quiet, and toasty warm once it has heated. I am very happy with this unit, and give it a high recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: SmtShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected 🙁
customer_reviews.text: After 4 days of ownership..... This heater Intermittently makes a loud clicking noise that increases in sound for 20-30 seconds. This cycle continues every 10 minutes or so and occurs the entire time the unit is in use. It kept me up all night. I had an older model one of these before. It was quiet and put out much more heat . The model I received is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, But It Smelled, No Matter How Many Hours I "Tempered" It
customer_reviews.text: I am glad the manufacturers took the unit back. It smelled of a weird oil smell, even after "tempering it" , leaving it outside, full on for collectively 20 hours. When I did have it in the house, it DOES heat up nicely, but my lungs were hurting with that smell. Fix the smell, and you can then have a nice product!
customer_reviews.author: John Yoga

customer_reviews.title: Heats really well!
customer_reviews.text: You do not need to heat the entire house with the central heating system; you can use this radiator heater and heat the one room you are using and save on the power bill. Seems much safer than other types of heaters where you have exposed heating elements or you must use oil or kerosene to produce heat, then have ventilation, and risk carbon monoxide poisoning. With this heater, there are no exposed elements, no need for ventilation and no need for the purchase of kerosene or oil; this is a clean way to heat.
customer_reviews.author: mmussori

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small rooms
customer_reviews.text: I needed additional heat source for a small north-side bathroom and this has been perfect. Set on low and the therm set at medium, it keeps the room a comfortable 70 degrees. Clean, attractive appearance, and quiet running.
customer_reviews.author: Scifysponge

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small bedroom not very big at all and the first time I used this it worked excellent! This is the second time I've used it and I'm hardly getting any heat out I may be returning this asking for a refund
customer_reviews.author: kym

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is coated with some kind of terrible toxic oil that chokes the user — even after “seasoning” it outside for hours on high. It’s a health hazard and it literally made me sick!
customer_reviews.author: craigwasson

customer_reviews.title: Heater leaked oil
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these heaters. I had been warned that they really smell when you first use them and it's true.I don't know why this step can't be handled by manufacturer before shipping.It took a full day before the smell started to go away. AT that point I plugged in the second heater to go through the same process.I never got it to stop smelling because at that point it started leaking oil all over the floor. Didn't order a replacement and now I'm concerned the remaining heater will leak at some point. Will be checking out local retailers and hopefully find one that has a better product. Don't have any idea why this product got such good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Ecuyer

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: great for your ability to control the temp. Great value for 60 dollars I have probably had 5 of these in 20 years. Not because they have failed of broken, because i keep giving the dam things away to friends who i find using non radiator space heaters. Ultimately upgrading tot he newest model for myself. when we had thermostat problem in the new house, two of these kept 2000 square feet comfortably warm in 40 degree weather
customer_reviews.author: oshirenshi

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought one of these heaters in January 2017. It worked properly for under a year in my child's room (this is California, so we only used it for a few months)... then it lost heating power and started sparking. (Literally, we could hear pops and see flashes.) By the time I asked my son what the pops were, and he told me the heater had been doing that for a while, the heater was just at a year old, so out of warranty. Basically, this is a piece of very dangerous garbage.
customer_reviews.author: V&R Sanders

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is easy enough to use and put off good heat in ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not listen to any reviews on electric heaters helping your electric bill. Ours was $700 after using our heaters to help our struggling heat pump in the south during the freeze. We have a huge house but we don't usually have a bill over 3 or 400$. Won't be using these unless the furnace is out. The product itself is easy enough to use and put off good heat in small rooms with high ceilings. We also used a couple of different styles and brands but they were all set at 70 degrees. If you're only using one it might be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Scombs

customer_reviews.title: These have lasted 16 years now. Excellent product for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100 yo home, cold. I keep one in the kids room, one with the birds and one for me. I turn them on at the first sign of cold, they stay on all winter, day and night, keeping these 3 rooms 72. The rest of the house is 65. Electric is not affected that much if you set them, pretty low actually and leave them alone. Just bought 2 more with the prediction of the the worst winter in history, ugh.
customer_reviews.author: N..k. Sepp

customer_reviews.title: Two with dents in the same place
customer_reviews.text: The product works quite well and meets my expectations. However, we ordered the product and it came dented. The box was not damaged, but it did look like it had been re-sealed. Amazon was very helpful, gave us a paid return label and sent us a new one. The new one had a dent in the same place. We decided to keep it and not go through the hassle of returning another one. I guess my expectation is to get a new unit that is not a factory second. It looked like both of these had been returned before.
customer_reviews.author: Pebbles

customer_reviews.title: Returned - Reeks of Fumes - Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I usually love delonghi products but they've gone downhill. We own 2 others that are older and they work great. Returned last two heaters for Fume smell that wouldn't stop even over a long period of time. Called customer service and they say it's normal.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kronig

customer_reviews.title: It heats up a room quick. Even an insulated ...
customer_reviews.text: It heats up a room quick. Even an insulated 2 car garage during winter time will rise 10 degrees or so. I can defintely smell some sort of oder whenever the unit is on high. But in a bedroom, high is not needed. In the garage high is needed, but the smell is not that noticeable due to other tools, etc already in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Peppy

customer_reviews.title: Works great...
customer_reviews.text: While the is heating down in my home, mind you I only live in a 800 sq ft home, I bought one and put it in my living room. I definitely did some research before deciding to buy this particular one. I took into consideration, price, reviews and quality and I have not been disappointed. I've only had it a week and it has heated it up the living room and the area around it and kept it very comfortable. For me it's done exactly what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Meek

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Reliable Heater!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good heater! Takes a moment to heat up space, but when it gets going it's great! There is a dial thermostat and a "comfort button" but it seems to be more of a target area then a control. Even on low settings with the button, it can get pretty warm, but it doesn't go crazy over. It is warm to the touch, but not overly hot, not going to burn anyone! Cools pretty quick and easy to move to different rooms if need be!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with this product from the start. The front panel detached from the radiator the first time I turned it on. I just screwed the panel cover back on but I should have just returned it. It was always very difficult to keep the temperature at a comfortable level. It was either too hot or too cold no matter how we adjusted the thermostat. Just last night it stopped working after only using it for about 5 months total for 7-8 hours a night. The first delonghi heater I purchased in 2012 and it lasted until last year due to a leak in the radiator. I will avoid delonghi heaters in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff & Claire Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Great unit outputs a lot of heat
customer_reviews.text: Works great! High quality build. Great heat for our entire bedroom area, where we have been able to completely replace the need to not use the older and noisy wall AC/ heater unit that came with the rented apt. No noise at all so we are not woken by a creaking metal sound that some other reviews for other lesser heaters have complained about. I would definitely recommend this DeLonghi heater.
customer_reviews.author: FlowJoe

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive results.
customer_reviews.text: Weak. Can keep a bathroom at 70 but not bedroom. Tried with and without "comfort" green button. The wire wrap at the bottom made no sense, there is no where to keep the wire in place at the end of wrapping The wheels are shite. You have to lift from one end, and rolling becomes harder with spinning wheels. Needed to have two large fixed wheels on the ground when lifting from the handle front... Basic design issues. Basic heating issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kohli Family

customer_reviews.title: I have several black delonghi heaters that work great! My house is large/ open floor plan
customer_reviews.text: I have several black delonghi heaters that work great! My house is large/ open floor plan. However, this white heater does not work as well as my other heaters. I think it has something to do with the "coils" being thinner. I do not recommend this product!!!!! I would buy this one instead.... DeLonghi EW7507EB Oil Filled Radiator Heater Black 1500W. It works great for a large room with high ceilings. However, you may need several if you are using these to heat your home.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Good heat out put. Easy to use. Move around. Nice can lower wattage when desired heat met. If electric bill agrees wil purchase another. In NY heat pump runs constant due to drafts and vents in ceiling due to central air using same vent. Hope this supplement keep heat literally “Grounded” while reducing constant activation of heat pump. Will update review after electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret O.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful! This is a 1500 Watt heater and ...
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! This is a 1500 Watt heater and if your house is not wired correctly, you may start an outlet fire. It happened to me, however on the wall opposite to where I plugged the heater. This is because it overcharged the circuits and the weakest link gave in. Make sure your circuitry can handle 1500 Watt before you plug it in and always plug into a surge protector. I only gave it 3 because it did not contain very clear warnings about this. Otherwise, it works ok. One solution might also be to have a separate outlet that goes directly into the breaker box and does not share the circuits with the other outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 Thumbs Up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these from Amazon November 2010 and after almost 3 years of use, they are all working better than expected. They work in my small home very well. I thought when I bought and remodeled this old house of mine that I would try them for one winter and later install central heating. Well, I still have not installed central heating. With one in each room, my home is more than comfortable during the coldest of months here in NoCenTex. If you need heaters, I would suggest buying these asap. Mine cost $44.00 each in 2010 here at Amazon and now they are $69. There's no telling what they will cost next year. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nana Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working at Full Power
customer_reviews.text: This space heater struggled to heat a 13x11 drafty room that had no other heat source (outdoor temp around 40 degrees F), and after 6 months functioned only at half power, so basically stopped fulfilling its purpose. Because of this I would not purchase it again. But it was silent, and that is the holy grail for me. Doesn’t matter if it stops working though. I bought a stronger model, and that one works well so far (1.5 months in) but has an electrical buzz. Where is the perfect silent room heater?
customer_reviews.author: teabird

customer_reviews.title: Good portable heater
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Portable. You can carry it everywhere. - Auto turns on when temp drops (ideal for sleeping) - Very quiet. Cons: - Takes several minutes to heat up. - Good only for small rooms
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: Works great, as expected. I love it
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews before purchasing because I was buying mostly for my 1.5 yr old's room through the winter. His room is on the north side of an older home so it gets colder. The reviews that I read were accurate in such that it takes a little bit to heat up but once it does it keeps a room at the temp you set it at. And it's safe. It will heat up a pretty good sized room as well. I would move this puppy from my sons room to the living room during the day to keep from having to turn the heat up too high.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to heat up a tiny studio apartment. The first one I ordered didn't work at all and had to be returned. The second one works, but doesn't heat up the space at all, even on maximum heat. You can't even feel the heat unless you're standing right next to it. Even after it runs for hours, the room is still frigid. The controls are confusing and dysfunctional, and the instructions are poorly written. I wish I had bought a smaller, cheaper radiator instead!
customer_reviews.author: R. Mulvey

customer_reviews.title: Does it job, it Keeps a room warm.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how economical it is, but it really keeps a room toasty. I choose this over the TRD040615T (Dragon 4),as that unit was more expensive, and from my reading, it did not have a timer override. I already had a "heavy duty" timer, just connect this unit to it and voila, I now have a heater on a timer, that I can override with the flick of a switch. Just don't forget to "burn it in", to get rid of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Sith

customer_reviews.title: Great heaters
customer_reviews.text: These heaters put off the right amount of heat. Easy to store at the end of the cold season too. I paired them with "smart plugs" so our bedroom is nice and warm before we wake up in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Arbuckle

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough
customer_reviews.text: If you set it on high and run it for an hour it'll start smelling like burnt oil. Even on high setting the heat is very low and because the heat is omnidirectional you don't quite feel the heat when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Wong

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient heat
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, heats room quickly and efficiently. Wow. This little dynamo is a gem. I bought a different brand first needing extra heat for my small rustic (aka drafty) “treehouse” - this heater packs a punch heating two largish rooms quickly. The lowest setting is almost too warm but. Have never had to run on full power even with below freezing temps. Love this little heater!
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HEATER!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these heaters for many years and always appreciate the technology, the ease of use and the reliable, steady heat they provide. I find them a good middle ground because they don't burn fossil fuels to provide warmth, but electricity from my solar panels and they're totally quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Clayperson13

customer_reviews.title: Leaks started the first year!!
customer_reviews.text: Had unit for 2 years now. Leak developed within first winter use. Attempted to fix but still leaks from seam. Expected better for the $$. This was my first oil heater experience. Research says leaks are rare so guess I was unlucky. Included a pic of the leak. Update: called company since I read on their website they had a 7 year warranty on oil heaters.. apparently it's only 1 year from purchase date and the only thing they could offer was to buy another heater from them at a discount.. yeah right.. I will reattempt to fix before I drop $$ again...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these oil heaters. They are not so drying to the air. I bought this one for my living room that has a high ceiling. I also live in a cold climate. I think this DeLonghi could of been made better for the price. It kinda make more noise when it cools down then I remember the others making. I just didn't warm up the open room as i was hoping. When the temp drops below 40, it's a secondary unit. But I moved it into a smaller bedroom and it heats that room nicely. Advertised for med to big rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Henderson

customer_reviews.title: This Product works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is my second winter with this product. I like that this product works fine and produce heat and do not dry my throat and it is safe. I do not like it does not have its own thermostat, it would have been very easy to provide a thermostat on this product to control room temperature in your room. But apart from that, it is a good product without any maintenance and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: blusterfind

customer_reviews.title: Safe and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my mom. Her room was not as warm as she wanted. This is a subtle heat source. Reduced fire hazard as it does not have exposed heating element. Quiet operation. Cost efficient. You do need to plan ahead and turn unit on 30 minutes before bedtime (in her case)
customer_reviews.author: CamelLot

customer_reviews.title: Toasty
customer_reviews.text: I love these heaters. They really do a good job. You just have to make sure you don’t expect them to heat a really big room. You’d need more than one. Mine will heat my bedroom easily. It is probably about a 13x13 or close. I got a tiny one and it works in my little bathroom really well.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Lass

customer_reviews.title: no weird smell, no weird sounds, no leakage, pretty happy.
customer_reviews.text: I wonder if people who experienced issues didn't take the proper precautions before using the heater. As far as I'm concerned, because there's a thermal fluid in there I treated it like a new fridge, and let it sit for a few hours before using it and it's worked nice for a week now. Soft heat, silent operation, on the lowest setting with the thermostat on the lower third it provides enough to heat up our 9*12 bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and toasty
customer_reviews.text: I placed this heater in my living room which opens to all other living areas and it really warms the entire space. At number 2 Min- the heat output is perfect and you can touch the unit without getting burn.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: it works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a very small room and I can put it on low and it keeps the room warm and then turns off
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great reviews, but...
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not put out enough heat to warm a closet, let alone a average sized room. It is hot to the touch. It will not cause a burn, but will make you jump back if you get too close. The only way to adjust the temp is with a dinky little dial. I am returning it for not living up to what is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Sized
customer_reviews.text: I needed a slim line heater to fit in a specific narrow location in one of my bathrooms as a back heater in the event of a power outage. The amps this heater pulls works well with my generator. I could not be more pleased with the performance and style of this oil heater.
customer_reviews.author: V. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great heaters
customer_reviews.text: We've got 2 of these heaters, and they're great! There's so many easy options for customising the heat output. The hottest setting puts out a lot of heat, but the metal won't burn if you bump it. My cat happily runs against it at the hottest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Vartanian

customer_reviews.title: De'Longhi Oil-Filled Radiator Space Heater is a good value
customer_reviews.text: My first De'Longhi oil filled heater lasted more than 10 years. Nice product for my office in my basement
customer_reviews.author: MTBNortheast

customer_reviews.title: This is the third DeLonghi oil filled heater we have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the third DeLonghi oil filled heater we have owned but this one doesn't have a cover on the back side of the heater. It is very hot and I have burnt myself on that side. Why doesn't it have another side cover? It used to have handles on both sides so it could be moved around. NOW, it only has a handle on ONE SIDE which is impossible to move it with and the other side is way too hot to touch to move it. Please let me know why you changed this heater? To be cheaper???????
customer_reviews.author: Edony V. Elder

customer_reviews.title: Price and Product Quality are Hand in Hand
customer_reviews.text: I moved into an older apartment building and the owner removed all the old fashion (which I love!) radiators. I therefore have no heat in my bathroom. This DeLonghi Radiator Space Heater fits the space in my bathroom, its very portable and heats up my bathroom in about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Roseann

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these ( of different generations) scattered around my house in "cold spots." They work seemlessly, quietly and best, safely. Keep me from having to crank up the furnace all the time when I move from room to room. Delighted with them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: constant popping noises
customer_reviews.text: every 5 - 10 minutes, it kept making popping noises over and over. this happened from the very minute we plugged it in. it kept waking us up. called the manufacturer and they said it would eventually stop. When pressed, they would not state what "eventually" meant. So after three days of continuous popping and no end in sight, we sent it back. purchased a cheaper brand locally and have had no/no problems.
customer_reviews.author: lilburn deskins

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, maybe for a very tiny enclosed room
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile to heat up and doesn’t heat the living room, you have to have it right in front of you. It was my first time purchasing a radiator heater. It will be my last. I’m not happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Diva

customer_reviews.title: If quiet heat is what you want
customer_reviews.text: The unit is quiet and that is what I really was looking for. It takes a little effort to get the setting to the exact temperature you want. The automatic "comfort" button is probably a good place to start and you can tweak it from there. I never use the max power setting. The lower setting is just right. The unit gets warm but not nearly hot enough to burn.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Has been running 24 7 all winter. It is efficient but you have to have realistic expectations. It puts out as much heat as any plug in 1500 watt heater can, but it is not in an obvious way. It is slow and constant and not a blast of radiant heat. I run mine on the medium setting. Its been below zero a good part of this winter and this smooths the heat out in rooms the wood stove doesnt reach, and overnight. Dont expect it (Or ANY space heater)to entirely heat more than a room in these kind of temps, but it does the job it should.
customer_reviews.author: udontknowme

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality But Not Engery Efficient
customer_reviews.text: For a few weeks, I used the heater to heat up my great room in the evening and the master bedroom overnight. I rarely used my whole house gas heater during this time, maybe only a couple of nights a week. I was hoping this heater would help lower my gas and electric bill but it actually went up. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative to blowing space heaters.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve been pleased with this heater. I use it in an unheard enclosed patio that doubles as a sunroom for my plants and art studio for me. It does get hot to the touch I. The sides so it’s not ideal for toddlers or pets who like to lean on things.
customer_reviews.author: Kcdreams

customer_reviews.title: This oil radiator leaks oil and wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Well another appliance fail - this reconditioned used Delonghi “safe heat” oil filled radiator started leaking oil for no apparent reason. There’s no way to get it to stop according. To their technical support so I have to throw it out only after a couple of uses. The seller is no longer on Amazon so I have no recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Picks n Pans

customer_reviews.title: Puts out a lot of heat.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that with the ComforTemp button depressed it gets extremely hot even at the lowest setting possible. Couldn't even touch it and it is in a nursery! Turn that off and it seems to respond to the thermostat settings just as it should. Keeps the nursery nice and warm at night in Minnesota.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: This is a good stand alone heater and very easy to use and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good stand alone heater and very easy to use and move around, definitely recommend it just don't expect it to heat up the room in a short time, best to leave it on a low setting first then you can adjust afterwards for long term.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Gets super hot when on and blew a fuse. Returned!
customer_reviews.text: We had it in our medium size bedroom and it kind of got the room warmer. It is suppose to sit by the biggest draft which is our windows but we have curtains so that makes it a fire hazard. It gets very hot to the touch when it is on. Used it one night and it blew a fuse so our house lost power at midnight when it was the only thing being used. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Sanders

customer_reviews.title: High electric usage
customer_reviews.text: While this rediator does the job, it is NOT energy efficient at all! It doubled my monthly electricity bill. On one of its lower settings it used around 2-3.5 kWh. When it’s turned off our household usage is around 0.3 kWh. I would not recommend using it for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: smadar

customer_reviews.title: Function great, design so-so
customer_reviews.text: Love the way it works - quietly. Can't tell if the thermostat function works properly all the time as the menu seems to indicate both the 700w and 800w switches have to be on for the thermostat function to work. There are at least two things that are annoying - 1. The cord comes out from the front instead of from the back or at least from the side. 2. The huge circular idiot blue light on the front lights up the room at night.
customer_reviews.author: HK Wong

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater, Limited Heat Output
customer_reviews.text: I used this heater to heat an otherwise unheated room in my home. I feel very safe using it because no surface gets extremely hot, but the heater doesn't output as much heat as others. I have found that blowing a box fan through the heater really helps get it heating better.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T

customer_reviews.title: Good heater so far.
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for the final test. So far it has performed very well for my application. Am waiting to see how the anti-freeze function works as the temps here are expected to drop into the teens this week. Not able to evaluate power consumption at this time. Does produce a comfortable heat and has provided good service in my setting. If the freeze function works properly and the energy consumption is acceptable this could be a 5+ rating????????
customer_reviews.author: gshpdoc

customer_reviews.title: FIRE HAZARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this in 2018. Heat was so-so. But the scary thing is what you see in the photos. We had to move the unit and when we unplugged it, the rubber/plastic plug was melting around the prongs and rising up between the metal prongs. This is a definite fire hazard. DO NOT BUY THIS UNIT. I'm contacting DeLonghi.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and easy to fall over
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this oil-filled heater got high ratings. It constantly makes loud clicking sound, which is disturbing to sleep and very annoying. My daughter complained about its smell. The most dangerous thing is that it falls over easily! The wheels are prone to turn in which causes the whole thing to fall over. If you want to have a hot heater falls on your baby and leave stripes of burn marks on her skin, go ahead, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Y Sena

customer_reviews.title: We like how movable it is with the swivel wheels
customer_reviews.text: This item came securely packaged and the instructions for minimal assembly (just putting the wheels on) and operation were sufficient. We are used to ceramic space heaters and this does not put out as much directional heat as they do. It is more of a radiant heat throughout the room that you really only notice when you go into another room and that room is colder. We like how movable it is with the swivel wheels. I would purchase again. It does get hot to the touch but not so much that you are going to burn yourself with a brief touch.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Saffe, effective supplementary heat
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my senior mother. I was looking for a safe and effective, yet economical way to supplement her central heat. She lives on an older house with poor central air circulation that isn't repairable. This heater is doing a great job. It heats and maintains the room to a comfortable temperature. I don't have to worry about CO, fire hazard or injury. Love this oil-filled radiator.
customer_reviews.author: SSMorgan

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater
customer_reviews.text: Good heater for small spaces. We bought this space heater as Christmas gifts, one for our father and one for our son and daughter-in-law. Everyone was pleased with how well it worked for a small area, not so great for open spaces.
customer_reviews.author: MLC

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet, doesn’t have a smell.
customer_reviews.text: Good heater for a small standard size room. I live on the east coast where it can be about 10° At night, this heater won’t cut it, it takes a long time to warm up the room. But the best part of this heater is that it’s very quiet, it doesn’t have any smell either, and it has a temp control button. I gave it a 4 star because the amount of time it takes to heat up my room.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Jermaine

customer_reviews.title: Love this heater but this particular one has a smell
customer_reviews.text: We love this heater and own another one. This one in particular has a strong paint like smell even after following the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: luna

customer_reviews.title: Good for Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good purchase. I needed some heat due to the lack of it in my small apartment. This heater very quickly heats up my room to the desired temperature. Very easy to use and clean. The best part is that due to the wheels on the bottom, it is very easy to move around. Super happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Prianka Masud

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great choice!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these and I think they do a great job to warm up a room so that u can leave the thermostat lower. Not sure what they cost to run and don’t care for the eco-setting but otherwise I’d recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable heat that's not going to dry you out!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this radiator brand for years and am still pleased with the two additional units I bought recently. I encourage you to get one when you need heat in a specific area. Great for an elderly person's room!
customer_reviews.author: Becca F

product_meta.title: De'Longhi Oil-Filled Radiator Space Heater, Quiet 1500W, Adjustable Thermostat, 3 Heat Settings, Timer, Energy Saving, Safety Features, Nice for Home with Pets/Kids, Light Gray, Comfort Temp EW7707CM
product_meta.description: Effectively and efficiently heat any room of the house with the De'Longhi ComforTemp portable oil-filled radiator. Worried about your electric bill? This heater actually saves you money by automatically maintaining the optimal room temperature. Simply press the ComforTemp button for the ultimate in energy savings. The heater even produces the maximum amount of radiant heat while ensuring a low surface temperature, making the radiator a nice choice for homes with pets or kids. The user-friendly control panel offers an adjustable thermostat and three heat settings to customize your heating needs. The anti-freeze setting allows the unit to automatically turn itself on when the temperature drops below 44 degrees F. Safety highlights include rust-resistant durable metal construction, a gently rounded design, and a thermal cut-off function that automatically turns the heater off if it starts to overheat. With its sleek look and silent operation, the De'Longhi oil-filled radiator is the perfect solution to all your heating needs. The heating power settings on the 1500 Watt heater are: Min - 700W, Mid - 800W, Max - 1500W.
feature_bullets: Lower energy bills by heating only the room you’re in, you can lower your thermostat and lower your energy bills.
No assembly required only De’Longhi has patented SmartSnap pre-assembled wheels that require no assembly and make it easy to move from room to room.
Comfort temp technology: Cuts your costs by automatically maintaining the optimal temperature and power settings.
Personalized comfort: Adjustable thermostat and multiple heat settings. Fins:7
Maintenance free system: The oil system is permanently sealed, so you never need to worry about refilling the heater. Cord storage - Yes

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,633 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
